page.title: 08KINGSNORTH ROAD
page.content: This road runs due south/south_east through the block. Starting in the town centre it acts as a link with the farmland southwards to the sea, serving as a market way for sheep and crops.In the northern part of the block the road is densely housed and main building periods are easily identified, late Victoria/Edwardian at the North end, 1920 & 30s at the centre and a few modern bungalow, houses where it abuts the farmland. One general food shop serves this area of the map, people preferring the town for bulk shopping. The Kingsnorth Road finishes at the town/parish border but continues on its way as the A2070 and passes the village on its way Southwards to Romney Marsh.
